data.title: Cursor::moveLeft & Cursor::moveRight should take column variable
data.body: I think that you should be able to move the cursor left or right a certain amount of columns.  Right now, the functions only can move right or left 1 column.  Which made me confused at first, until I looked them up.  A work around is to wrap the functions in a loop.

data.title: Core specs fail if window isn't focused
data.body:
I'm not sure how this is working on CI, but locally the window needs to be focused to prevent certain specs from failing. This hasn't come up until recently, so I'm suspecting it could have something to do with the Chrome 35+ upgrade.

@zcbenz could anything have changed that would affect this?

data.title: Integrate Atom API lookup
data.body:
This is to track the [idea](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3122) to allow package developers to conveniently access Atom API documentation for classes, methods etc, directly from the source code.

This might be done via a second pane for each call, showing the docs HTML page for the selected method/class etc.
Or maybe via an inline tool-tip kind of implementation, similar to popular IDEs.

data.title: "Look up in Zeal" in right-click menu?
data.body: Dash is a very good solution for offline doc, but Mac-only :( Luckily there's a good alternative for it named [Zeal](http://zealdocs.org/) by @jkozera. In Atom, I'd like to get "Look up in Zeal" in right-click menu like "Look up in Dash".

data.title: Style mini editors
data.body: Makes the react mini editors behave just like they did before.

data.title: Remove vendored dlls
data.body: Do not merge until https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/pull/530 is merged and released.

data.title: Feature Request: add setup panel for proxy settings
data.body:
User should have a settings panel in Atom Settings for proxy.

PS: 
i know can can add manually a proxy here:

 `~/.atom/.apmrc` 
(Windows: `Atom\resources\app\apm\node_modules\atom-package-manager\.apmrc`)

but for newbe users of atom it would be better to have a settings panel

data.title: Cursor isn't blinking when focusing React mini editors with placeholder text
data.body:
Here I'm clicking between two fields. You can't see the cursor in the one with placeholder text.

![focus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/3737679/4faddc5e-1739-11e4-8e65-e706466c19f5.gif)

data.title: Atom should use my windows internet proxy settings
data.body:
i use atom at windows 7 pro

i have setup a proyx at: Tools->Internet Options->Connections tab->Lan Settings button

1) atom should use this settings

or

2) offer a settings panel to setup proxy

data.title: coffeelint!
data.body:
**324 warnings in 42 files** (coffeelint) have been fixed.

Mostly just unnecessary double quotes, unnecessary fat arrows, miss-spaced `->` and empty functions (`-> return`). I have not been able to run the specs on my setup, so please feel free to do so on your own (in case I broke something).

Greets

data.title: Cannot open a file through Webdav on Windows
data.body:
Hello,

I'm working with some webdav file repository (actually a SharePoint server).

I'm trying to open a file from this repository with Atom (Windows 8.1 X64), but this does not works. Atom opens, but the editor is empty.

For example, if I try to open `http://myserver/Style%20Library/XSL%20Style%20Sheets/rss.xsl` it fails.

Using Fiddler, I can trace these http paquets:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/184604/3733446/0fb204ee-1708-11e4-983d-f48d7a02269a.png)

(the process is svchost because of Windows "WebClient" service to wrap WebDav access).

I guess the 404 errors may be ignored, as it's only a _try to find a file_ request.

The two last responses are:

```
HTTP/1.1 207 MULTI-STATUS
Via: 1.1 FW02
Connection: Keep-Alive
Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Length: 7094
Date: Tue, 29 Jul 2014 10:01:28 GMT
Content-Type: text/xml
Server: Microsoft-IIS/7.5
Cache-Control: no-cache
X-SharePointHealthScore: 0
Public-Extension: http://schemas.microsoft.com/repl-2
SPRequestGuid: e23ba99c-8e3a-f07d-d7df-865474ff42bc
request-id: e23ba99c-8e3a-f07d-d7df-865474ff42bc

SPRequestDuration: 18
SPIisLatency: 0
Persistent-Auth: false
X-Powered-By: ASP.NET
MicrosoftSharePointTeamServices: 15.0.0.4420
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-MS-InvokeApp: 1; RequireReadOnly
```

Let me know if I can help in any manner.

data.title: Missing menu bar in linux
data.body:
On Ubuntu 12.04, building from anything more recent than b0aa5e6c8848be00fa119611980371485736ba4f the main menu bar seems to have vanished.

Presumably this is related to #3032.

From b0aa5e6c8848be00fa119611980371485736ba4f : 
![screenshot - 290714 - 10 37 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/120506/3733057/16d0fc02-1704-11e4-8157-a36e8e451a31.png)

From 397871a012d009fad9f12fb4414b8f73a3ce3396 (the closest one after that that I could get to build successfully) :
![screenshot - 290714 - 10 37 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/120506/3733066/32c59c56-1704-11e4-9cfe-136da50ed03b.png)

data.title: File rename issue
data.body:
With Atom 0.120.0, on OSX (with case insensitive filesystem).

What I did:
First i left-click the file "test.php" in the Atom editor tree view to open it.
Next I right-click the same file and select "Rename".

What happens:
When i rename "test.php" to "Test.php", the opened file tab label does not update, and still says "test.php".
If I now click this file (to open it, it was already open in a tab) - i end up with two tabs, one "test.php", one "Test.php". Due to the case insensitivity of the file system I use, they happen to point to the same file.

What I expected to happen:
The opened file tab label to change to "Test.php" when i renamed the file.

data.title: Upgrade to Chrome36
Close all tabs but not the window
data.body:
Atom seem to copy this very annoying behaviour from recent builds of Sublime Text 3 where it was in fact fixed in the latest build.

I propose `Cmd+Shift+W` to close all tabs but not the window. It is really annoying to close all tabs one by one before starting a new feature.

And even then `Cmd+Shift+W` in fact just closes window so when you reopen the project – all tabs stay and you have to close them one by one anyway.

Suggestion:

`Cmd+W` - Close tab
`Cmd+Shift+W` - Close all tabs but not the window
`Cmd+W` - Close window if there are no tabs left

data.title: Getting Access To Original File Path (Un-standardized)
data.body:
I see that in 2013, you ran into many issues with symlinked paths (#320, #329). I would like to get access to the file path for the project root and files / directories within that are _not_ standardized so that I can use the non-standardized paths with external tools.

See https://github.com/joefitzgerald/go-plus/issues/50 for additional context.

This commit seems to have introduced standardized paths: https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/82bce082efa971d053f6a7d2d32bbd50b61f2305

data.title: JavaScript one-line if statement indentation
data.body:
When I type a one-line `if` statement in JavaScript, the next line that I type gets indented.

I'm using Atom v0.106.0 on Mac OS X 10.9.2.
![atom-screenshot-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7763597/3729099/6fec2918-16b6-11e4-82f3-ac671f0293c4.png)

data.body:
Example:
1. Select text `aa`
   ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7157049/3724616/fefd8dcc-167f-11e4-82fc-b8e3aeff987a.png)
2. Press `ctrl+d` for next selection
   ![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7157049/3724614/fefcd8fa-167f-11e4-9e0a-6d44a51450c5.png)
3. Press `ctrl+d` for next selection
   ![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7157049/3724615/fefcfc5e-167f-11e4-954a-5b232ca901f9.png)
4. I expect editor to select next occurrence of text on `ctrl+d`, but initial search string is now lost.

data.title: Apply React editor font styles via CSS instead of inline styles
data.body:
/cc @benogle 

Previously, editors always assigned their font styles inline based on the config settings. We then had some mini-editor-specific styles for the line height and opted out of setting the line height inline for mini editors only. This was kind of a confusing mess.

This PR updates the editors to behave just like ordinary HTML elements, using whatever the computed font styles are on the root editor element as the basis of our rendering decisions. The setting of the font size, font family, and line height is now moved to a global stylesheet that is managed by the workspace view. This will allow us to style mini editors (or any other editor for that matter) in a manner specific to its context with normal CSS.

This sets us up for the last step before switching to React-based mini editors, which is @benogle fixing the styling in key locations where mini editors are used.

data.title: ^M characters when saving plain text
data.body:
When i save file as plain text  it add ^M characters.
is there way to avoid that from happening ?

data.title: Show detailed React errors/warnings in devMode
data.body:
Fixes #3099.

React development mode has a lot of useful warnings and exceptions. These don't
show up in production mode. This change puts React into dev mode when Atom is
run via `atom --dev`.

data.title: Possible Translations?
data.body: Hi, how can I translate Atom into Azerbaijani language? Thanks!

data.title: Export Atom's version of React and Reactionary
data.body:
Fixes #3101 and works around facebook/react#1939.

This is needed for packages to use React until that React bug is fixed. If packages bundle their own copy of React, it will generate `reactid`s that conflict with core editor components. This breaks events.

data.title: Provide `require` access to modules used by Atom
data.body:
I'm not sure if this is already possible in some way, or if it's desirable beyond a very specific use case I have run into. 

I would like to be able to write `require "react-atom-fork"` in a package and get access to the version of React used by Atom itself. This works around a [React bug](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/1939) where having multiple copies of React on the same page leads to duplicate `reactid`s.

If the bug is not worked around, React will give the following error when events fire:

```
Invariant Violation: ReactMount: Two valid but unequal nodes with the same `data-reactid`
```

This is admittedly a very niche use case, and obviously the right fix is inside React, but I thought I'd open an issue since I think anyone trying to use React in a package will run into this.

data.title: Exclude paths when using Find In Files...
data.body: Would be great if I could exclude paths when using the Find In Files form. For instance, I would like to exclude `log/` and `index.js` while searching the rest of my project. Is this possible? If not, I think it would be a great addition!

data.title: Don't set NODE_ENV in development mode
data.body:
I'm working on a React-powered package and running into errors like this:

> Uncaught Error: Minified exception occured; use the non-minified dev environment for the full error message and additional helpful warnings.

This is controlled by the `NODE_ENV` environment variable, [which seems to not be configurable](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a3f046b948b940872d6d8a0778c677c9007b3323/src/atom.coffee#L153). 

Perhaps `atom --dev` could not set this variable so that errors are more readable? For now I'm building a new Atom with that line commented out.

data.title: Update linux.md
data.body: Add step for checking out the latest release by git tag.
